trans-unit.source: Launching, resuming, and background tasks
trans-unit.target: Launching, resuming, and background tasks

trans-unit.source: This section describes what happens when a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app is started, suspended, resumed, and terminated.
trans-unit.target: This section describes what happens when a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app is started, suspended, resumed, and terminated.

trans-unit.source: Launching, resuming, and background tasks
trans-unit.target: Launching, resuming, and background tasks

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]

trans-unit.source: This section describes what happens when a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app is started, suspended, resumed, and terminated.
trans-unit.target: This section describes what happens when a Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app is started, suspended, resumed, and terminated.

trans-unit.source: It covers how to activate apps by using a contract or extension, and how to use background tasks which allow a UWP app to do work even when the app is not in the foreground.
trans-unit.target: It covers how to activate apps by using a contract or extension, and how to use background tasks which allow a UWP app to do work even when the app is not in the foreground.

trans-unit.source: Finally, it covers how to add a splash screen to your app.
trans-unit.target: Finally, it covers how to add a splash screen to your app.

trans-unit.source: Background tasks and services
trans-unit.target: Background tasks and services

trans-unit.source: Topic
trans-unit.target: Topic

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Support your app with background tasks
trans-unit.target: Support your app with background tasks

trans-unit.source: The topics in this section show how to run your own lightweight code in the background by responding to triggers with background tasks.
trans-unit.target: The topics in this section show how to run your own lightweight code in the background by responding to triggers with background tasks.

trans-unit.source: Access sensors and devices from a background task
trans-unit.target: Access sensors and devices from a background task

trans-unit.source: [**DeviceUseTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn297337) lets your Universal Windows app access sensors and peripheral devices in the background, even when your foreground app is suspended.
trans-unit.target: [**DeviceUseTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn297337) lets your Universal Windows app access sensors and peripheral devices in the background, even when your foreground app is suspended.

trans-unit.source: Guidelines for background tasks
trans-unit.target: Guidelines for background tasks

trans-unit.source: Ensure your app meets the requirements for running background tasks.
trans-unit.target: Ensure your app meets the requirements for running background tasks.

trans-unit.source: Create and consume an app service
trans-unit.target: Create and consume an app service

trans-unit.source: Learn how to write a UWP app that can provide services to other UWP apps, and how to consume those services.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to write a UWP app that can provide services to other UWP apps, and how to consume those services.

trans-unit.source: Create and register a background task
trans-unit.target: Create and register a background task

trans-unit.source: Create a background task class and register it to run when your app is not in the foreground.
trans-unit.target: Create a background task class and register it to run when your app is not in the foreground.

trans-unit.source: Debug a background task
trans-unit.target: Debug a background task

trans-unit.source: Learn how to debug a background task, including background task activation and debug tracing in the Windows event log.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to debug a background task, including background task activation and debug tracing in the Windows event log.

trans-unit.source: Declare background tasks in the application manifest
trans-unit.target: Declare background tasks in the application manifest

trans-unit.source: Enable the use of background tasks by declaring them as extensions in the app manifest.
trans-unit.target: Enable the use of background tasks by declaring them as extensions in the app manifest.

trans-unit.source: Handle a cancelled background task
trans-unit.target: Handle a cancelled background task

trans-unit.source: Learn how to make a background task that recognizes cancellation requests and stops work, reporting the cancellation to the app using persistent storage.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to make a background task that recognizes cancellation requests and stops work, reporting the cancellation to the app using persistent storage.

trans-unit.source: Monitor background task progress and completion
trans-unit.target: Monitor background task progress and completion

trans-unit.source: Learn how your app can recognize background task progress and completion.
trans-unit.target: Learn how your app can recognize background task progress and completion.

trans-unit.source: Register a background task
trans-unit.target: Register a background task

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create a function that can be re-used to safely register most background tasks.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create a function that can be re-used to safely register most background tasks.

trans-unit.source: Respond to system events with background tasks
trans-unit.target: Respond to system events with background tasks

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create a background task that responds to [**SystemTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224839) events.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create a background task that responds to [**SystemTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224839) events.

trans-unit.source: Run a background task on a timer
trans-unit.target: Run a background task on a timer

trans-unit.source: Learn how to schedule a one-time background task, or run a periodic background task.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to schedule a one-time background task, or run a periodic background task.

trans-unit.source: Set conditions for running a background task
trans-unit.target: Set conditions for running a background task

trans-unit.source: Learn how to set conditions that control when your background task will run.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to set conditions that control when your background task will run.

trans-unit.source: Transfer data in the background
trans-unit.target: Transfer data in the background

trans-unit.source: Use the background transfer API to copy files in the background.
trans-unit.target: Use the background transfer API to copy files in the background.

trans-unit.source: Update a live tile from a background task
trans-unit.target: Update a live tile from a background task

trans-unit.source: Use a background task to update your app's live tile with fresh content.
trans-unit.target: Use a background task to update your app's live tile with fresh content.

trans-unit.source: Use a maintenance trigger
trans-unit.target: Use a maintenance trigger

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use the [**MaintenanceTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700517) class to run lightweight code in the background while the device is plugged in.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use the [**MaintenanceTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700517) class to run lightweight code in the background while the device is plugged in.

trans-unit.source: Add a splash screen
trans-unit.target: Add a splash screen

trans-unit.source: All UWP apps must have a splash screen, which is a composite of a splash screen image and a background color, both of which can be customized.
trans-unit.target: All UWP apps must have a splash screen, which is a composite of a splash screen image and a background color, both of which can be customized.

trans-unit.source: Your splash screen is displayed immediately when the user launches your app.
trans-unit.target: Your splash screen is displayed immediately when the user launches your app.

trans-unit.source: This provides immediate feedback to users while app resources are initialized.
trans-unit.target: This provides immediate feedback to users while app resources are initialized.

trans-unit.source: As soon as your app is ready for interaction, the splash screen is dismissed.
trans-unit.target: As soon as your app is ready for interaction, the splash screen is dismissed.

trans-unit.source: A well-designed splash screen can make your app more inviting.
trans-unit.target: A well-designed splash screen can make your app more inviting.

trans-unit.source: Here's a simple, understated splash screen:
trans-unit.target: Here's a simple, understated splash screen:

trans-unit.source: a 75% scaled screen capture of the splash screen from the splash screen sample.
trans-unit.target: a 75% scaled screen capture of the splash screen from the splash screen sample.

trans-unit.source: This splash screen is created by combining a green background color with a transparent PNG.
trans-unit.target: This splash screen is created by combining a green background color with a transparent PNG.

trans-unit.source: Putting an image and background color together to form the splash screen helps the splash screen look good, regardless of the device your app is installed on.
trans-unit.target: Putting an image and background color together to form the splash screen helps the splash screen look good, regardless of the device your app is installed on.

trans-unit.source: When the splash screen is displayed, only the size of the background changes to compensate for a variety of screen sizes.
trans-unit.target: When the splash screen is displayed, only the size of the background changes to compensate for a variety of screen sizes.

trans-unit.source: Your image always remains intact.
trans-unit.target: Your image always remains intact.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, you can use the [**SplashScreen**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224763) class to customize your app's launch experience.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, you can use the [**SplashScreen**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br224763) class to customize your app's launch experience.

trans-unit.source: You can position an extended splash screen, which you create, to give your app more time to complete additional tasks like preparing app UI or completing networking operations.
trans-unit.target: You can position an extended splash screen, which you create, to give your app more time to complete additional tasks like preparing app UI or completing networking operations.

trans-unit.source: You can also use the **SplashScreen** class to notify you when the splash screen is dismissed, so that you can begin entrance animations.
trans-unit.target: You can also use the **SplashScreen** class to notify you when the splash screen is dismissed, so that you can begin entrance animations.

trans-unit.source: Topic
trans-unit.target: Topic

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Add a splash screen
trans-unit.target: Add a splash screen

trans-unit.source: Set your app's splash screen image and background color.
trans-unit.target: Set your app's splash screen image and background color.

trans-unit.source: Display a splash screen for more time
trans-unit.target: Display a splash screen for more time

trans-unit.source: Display a splash screen for more time by creating an extended splash screen for your app.
trans-unit.target: Display a splash screen for more time by creating an extended splash screen for your app.

trans-unit.source: This extended screen imitates the splash screen shown when your app is launched, and can be customized.
trans-unit.target: This extended screen imitates the splash screen shown when your app is launched, and can be customized.
